pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded!

*And happy new year! ðŸŽ‰*


  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375314000/job/20066714118)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375314000/job/20066714082)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375314000/job/20066714012)
Maybe we also want an alias called `Finset.card_pair` (since we have `Multiset.card_pair)`.
There is already `Finset.card_doubleton`, which assumes `a \ne b`. Maybe it should be renamed... @YaelDillies what do you think?
Yes, `card_doubleton` should be called `card_pair`. I complained when Kyle added that lemma, but I wasn't heard.

This feels really clumsy; I wonder if in the long run we can do something like #5863 to avoid having uncountably many gaps in our API in places like this; so have a `Finset.card_le%` elaborator that generates these lemmas on the fly by reflection.

(no objection to merging as is modulo the other unresolved comments)
I didn't know we went as high as eight!

Those were added in [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/15684/commits/39bf3e27455a777312de7dd0d8c20dab5e24ba89), and apparently you reviewed that PR after the commit ...
I think having `Finset.card_le%` at a later stage is perfect. But I'm not the right person to write it.
